title: How much SPE stored in spring compared to original

content.question: A block on a horizontal surface is placed in contact with a light spring with spring constant <math alttext="k" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></math>, as shown in Figure 1. When the block is moved to the left so that the spring is compressed a distance <math alttext="d" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> from its equilibrium length, the potential energy stored in the spring-block system is <math alttext="E sub m" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> . When a second block of mass <math alttext="2 m" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>m</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is placed on the same surface and the spring is compressed a distance <math alttext="2 d" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>d</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, as shown in Figure 2, how much potential energy is stored in the spring compared to the original potential energy <math alttext="E sub m" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> ? All frictional forces are considered to be negligible.

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
